title: quinoa
ingredients: 1 scant Tbsp oil; extra virgin olive oil or avocado work
1.75 cup vegetable broth or water (see note); ideally hot.
instructions: Set a saucepan over medium heat. Rinse the quinoa in a fine mesh strainer and drain well.

Toast the quinoa. Add the oil to the saucepan and then the quinoa, stirring frequently to let the remaining water evaporate and the quinoa to toast. 2â€“3 minutes. You should smell the quinoa toasting.
Stir in the broth and bring to a boil. Once boiling, cover and reduce to the lowest heat. Leave to cook, undisturbed for 15 minutes.
Turn off heat but leave covered for 5 more minutes. Then fluff with a fork and let the residual steam evaporate, uncovered. Should be ready to serve in 5 minutes.
notes: If you don't have broth it's fine to substitute with water - just add 1/2 tsp salt.
